main event: A disc-shaped object with a convex top, estimated to be 25 feet in diameter, was observed hovering over Coraopolis, Pennsylvania, approximately 1.5 miles east of the Greater Pittsburgh Airport.
interesting points: The object had two red lights and one blue light, all blinking, on the top near the edges.
The object was observed at an elevation of 20 degrees and an azimuth of 90 degrees, hovering at approximately tree-top level.
The observer drove past the object without stopping, and it was also observed simultaneously by Battery A of the 93th AAA Missile Battalion.
The sighting occurred during an auroral display, which could have caused an optical illusion.
The object was not tracked on radar, and no other aircraft were reported in the area at the time.
sighted object: disc-shaped object with blinking red and blue lights
location: Coraopolis, PA, 1.5 miles east of Greater Pittsburgh Airport
witnesses: observer, Battery A of the 93th AAA Missile Battalion
